verbs.description: six mlb managerial openings not long ago [V: experienced] [ARG1: big - league managers] had their way in the baseball world floating from team to team with or without distinguished track records they were safe hires easy hires for the most part experienced managers landing jobs have gone the way of the bunt complete game and pepper we ’re seeing more candidates with no managing experience who are open to running a game based on a direction usually analytics - driven provided by the front office of the six openings last winter five were filled by rookies now there are six more openings houston omar vizquel billy beane ed sprague chili davis baseball theo epstein marlins coordinator general manager kyle hendricks gm oakland mike trout kris bryant houston astros diego minute maid park giants band stephen piscotty yusmeiro petit chicago cubs rangers chicago sun - times kent puerto rico orioles angels giants mike scioscia david bell alex cora jim riggleman astros brewers special assistant fernando rodney mark derosa a j hinch joe espada cubs tommy john diamondbacks joe girardi north san diego county 2002 world series buster posey mvp director eric chavez kyle schwarber hensley meulens javy baez billy eppler mlb blue jays mike bordick johnny cueto new york yankees toronto blue jays shohei ohtani yankees
